intro: Paliurus aculeatus var. inermis, commonly known as the smooth paliurus, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, round fruits. It is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The variety inermis is distinguished by its lack of thorns, unlike its more spiny relatives.
